subject: Career
title: The Network Audit
description: A 60-second lesson on The Network Audit.

hook.text: When was the last time you looked at your network and asked: 'Is this helping me grow?'

buildup.text: A network audit maps your connections by type: mentors, peers, sponsors, industry contacts, cross-industry.

discovery.text: Most people find gaps: too many peers, not enough senior contacts or cross-industry connections.

twist.text: A balanced network needs diversity: different levels, industries, geographies, and perspectives.

climax.text: Audit quarterly. Identify gaps. Set a goal: 'This quarter I'll connect with three people in X.'

punchline.text: You can't improve a network you haven't mapped.

quiz.question: What is the purpose of a network audit?
options: To identify gaps and ensure diversity in your connections
To remove people from your network
